reviewText: As a Christmas gift for a WWII buff
A knowledge of history is a great resource.  Wonderful and very informative.

Although this set of discs contains a lot of helpful information, Jews are mentioned only once.  Astounding!  There are lengthy visits to and descriptions of the death camps, but we are enlightened only as to the nationality of the victims, just one time including Jewish Germans.  Mostly we are led to believe these are political prisoners.  Twice religion is mentioned (as in religious enthusiasts).  Even when the little children are shown, it is not explained why little children would be in a camp of political prisoners.  The narrator gives details about the medical experiments, never mentioning the poor Jews.  Unforgiveable!!!

I give this set 5 stars because I found it worth that much; however, I must register this protest.  345 minutes of pictures and narration and (except for the short film on the Nuremburg trial), only one mention of Jews.
Some old info here of course but over all very much worth reviewing for those who are truly interested in this time period.
Very interesting documental, good footage, covering many areas of Nazi Germany. Recommended to people who likes history.
I wanted a bedrock collection of Film from WWII. Good overview of the War & Post-War, European theater. Good film quality.
For those interested in the Third Reich, this is a well-made and interesting compilation of film and photos of the history.
very good.

NOT as advertised!! there were 4 disc the first 1-1/2 discs were how old hitler didn't keep his promises on not doing anymore atks on the nearby countries and the last 2-1/2 discs were just on the consentration  camps,  nothing on how they gained power militarily and politically then peeked out and the decline and destruction of Germany.

The best I have viewed in my research on ETO WWII.  Of special interest is the portion on the psychology of the German people, showing how Hitler was able to grasp their emotions, thus creating the massive following.
